description:
AstenJohnson is the leader in technical fabrics. Our drive to provide the best products and service in our industry is fueled by our associates and their drive to innovate. We want our associates to build careers here and become part of the fabric of our 230 year old company. We offer competitive pay, excellent benefits and a workplace built on respect and purpose. 

 
General Scope of Responsibilities:
 The Continuous Improvement Team is an integral part of the Kanata dryer manufacturing team and monitors product quality and process conformance. The team also works closely with internal and external customers. 
Under the direction of the Continuous Improvement Team Leader, this position is responsible for liaising with manufacturing teams daily to ensure that quality standards are met and that roadblocks are removed. The specialist will also be responsible for supporting various aspects of CI operations such as New Product Development, Innovation, Lean Manufacturing, Non-Conformances, Corrective Actions, Customer Complaints, Best Practices and Operational Excellence. 
__________________________________________________________________________ 

 
Specific Responsibilities:
 
 
 Technical Support for manufacturing teams, product managers, dryer champions and field associates 
 Lean Manufacturing projects or special projects that are aligned with key business objectives 
 Investigate and address customer complaints 
 Root cause analysis and disposition of product or process non-conformances 
 Data collection and analysis 
 Production card verification and approval 
 Other CIT duties as required or assigned 
 
Preferable Position Requirements:
Position Requirements:
 
 
 Ability to serve as a team member, presenter, facilitator and trainer as the team role warrants 
 Be a self-starter with excellent organizational skills in planning and handling multiple tasks concurrently 
 Strong attention to details, self-motivation, innovation and ability to operate autonomously 
 Good troubleshooting skills 
 Data analysis 
 Passion for continuous improvement 
 Works well with internal and external customers 
 
Education & Years of Experience:
 
 
 College diploma in Quality Assurance, Engineering Technology or equivalent working / industry experience. 
 
Skills & Attributes:
 
 
 Experience in a Continuous Improvement function 
 Lean Six Sigma Certified Green or Black Belt 
 Proficient with Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint, 
 Strong verbal and written communication skills 
 Dependable and adaptable 
 Experience with SharePoint and JD Edwards 
 Understanding of manufacturing steps and dryer fabric products 
 We are an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants equally without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or disability status.
